promise-II</span></span></span></span></span></div><article class="post-172669 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-short-stories-love tag-feelings tag-life tag-love tag-memories tag-pain tag-teacher entry" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting" itemprop="blogPost"><header class="entry-header"><h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">Broken pieces of a promise-II</h1> ,<span class="alignleft"><img alt='' src='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6ca2170aee5dff0dd422a940d62cb082?s=85&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6ca2170aee5dff0dd422a940d62cb082?s=170&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-85 photo' height='85' width='85' /></span><p class="entry-meta">English Short Story published on <time class="entry-time" itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2017-01-13T13:12:28+00:00">January 13, 2017</time> by <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/author/sejal/" class="entry-author-link" itemprop="url" rel="author"><span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">sejal</span></a></span> <div class="textwidget"><p><strong>Excerpt: </strong> If he really loves her, it would not make any difference whether he find her or not. Love is not merely getting someone you love. It is the most beautiful feeling you possess for whole of your life.  <strong>(Reads: 251)</strong> </p></div><section id="text-before-content-ad" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle"></div><div class="textwidget" style="margin-bottom:10px;"><!--AD START--><div style="text-align: center;">,<!-- YSC_RESP_2 -->,<ins class="adsbygoogle",     style="display:block",     data-ad-client="ca-pub-9888966704027314",     data-ad-slot="2044367786",     data-ad-format="auto"></ins>,<script>,(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});,</script>          ,            </div><!--AD END--></div></div></section><section id="text-before-content" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle">&nbsp;</div><div class="textwidget"></div></div><section></p></header><div class="entry-content" itemprop="text"><blockquote data-secret="SrpQHutuBC" class="wp-embedded-content"><p><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/short-stories-love/short-story-love-broken-pieces-promise-1/">Broken pieces of a promise (1)</a></p></blockquote>,<p><iframe class="wp-embedded-content" sandbox="allow-scripts" security="restricted" style="position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);" src="http://yourstoryclub.com/short-stories-love/short-story-love-broken-pieces-promise-1/embed/#?secret=SrpQHutuBC" data-secret="SrpQHutuBC" width="500" height="282" title="&#8220;Broken pieces of a promise (1)&#8221; &#8212; Your Story Club" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no"></iframe></p>,<div id="attachment_13278" style="width: 460px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"><a href="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-13278" src="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg?w=450" alt="dry-flower-stones" srcset="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg?w=620 620w, http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg?resize=300%2C199 300w" sizes="(max-width: 620px) 100vw, 620px" data-recalc-dims="1" /></a><p class="wp-caption-text">Love Short Story &#8211; Broken pieces of a promise-II<br />Photo credit: <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/creative/solrac_gi_2nd" rel="nofollow external">solrac_gi_2nd</a> from <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/" rel="nofollow external">morguefile.com</a></p></div>,<p>After one month when he came back to Kanpur, straight away went on the terrace in hope to see his teacher. But he could not see her face for next one week, she had gone for an exam to Delhi. The time was killing him. Many times he went in front of her house but came back with a fear if she will get angry , she will never talk to him. Day by day he was becoming lean and weak as he was not taking food and care of health.</p>,<p>One day he went to the teacher’s house with one of his friend who has to clear some doubt before his class test. He was his junior at school. On seeing him she enquired what happen to him “what happened to you look so tired and ill.”  He wanted to tell so many things but could not make his mouth open in front of her. She asked again then he  told a lie that he had fever since last week and he was on prescription. Her simplest concern was more than  enough to feel better. Only ambition, only  dream he had ever had was the tuition teacher; lost interest in studies too.  In next year exams he could not get even pass marks and  got failed; nothing bothered him. He only wanted to see and talk to teacher. He started bunking classes in school, and left school after one more year of failure. Beyond her, he was not even thinking about his health. His parents were also got tensed what happened to him and they decided to consult a doctor for prescription, if required.</p>,<p>One evening he got the news that tuition teacher had got selection for some government job. He was not even ware of which job, which post. Only after three four years he could understand that she had cleared country’s most difficult exam i.e. civil services exam. She had to go for training outside the state and most probably her posting will be outside Kanpur. That was a great achievement of his teacher, all people were going to congratulate her, the favorite tuition teacher. He got a golden chance to talk to her and  went to congratulate her. This time, he was sure that he will definitely tell the things whatever he thinks. As he went inside house he saw already there were two old ladies sitting and blessing her. So he thought to wait there till they left. Her mother and those ladies were taking and then she came to kitchen. She noticed him standing beside the gate. She asked him to come in. He got privileged by inviting by her teacher that feeling mesmerized him. He congratulated her and told that he want to say something.</p>,<p>As, she used to treat all her students like her children, she told him to say. By that time his eyes were full of tears and could not utter a single word. Innocent teacher thought it was the affection towards teacher. He asked her phone  number, as if he wants some guidance she can help. Unhesitatingly, she gave her phone number.</p>,<p>The day came when she had to leave Kanpur. All the preparation had been over. He went to railway station to drop her. When she reached the training center he called her and told that he wants to say very urgent thing. That he loves her very much. On hearing those words She was totally shocked, breathless; she could not believe her ears. Told  &#8220;what bullshit you are talking&#8221;. He explained how he had been fascinated by her beautiful face and beaming, chirpy innocent smile, gleaming eyes, way of talking, her knowledge, her concerns toward her student, gracious voice seems canorous music to his ears…everything belongs to her  mesmerized him. Everything hypnotized him. He wants to marry her. From the very first day of tuition class he felt the feeling of love.</p>,<p>She had to go for training and it was just the beginning of her career, she did not want to spoil her mood. She realized, that was the infatuation at adolescence age. He should consider her like his mother he told that she was like his mother. She then told that he too young to get into relationship; he was ten years younger to her. But he never called her ithi didi instead he used to called her Ithi ji. That too shocked her.</p>,<p>She was very upset when she heard that he left the school. She was a teacher and treated student like her children and did not want to spoil the career and future of children. How can she think like that. She tried to make him understand that whatever he was talking was just an affection of adolescence age, after few days or months he will forget and he will be alright. This is normal so he should concentrate on his studies rather than wasting time on such useless thinking. He begged her to talk on regular basis, otherwise he cannot live. She understood the delicacy of matter and she will talk to him but he has to consider her as mother. After that she called him twice but she was afraid that he got psycho. She wanted to talk to his parents regarding the issues but got she had a fear that they will blame her for spoiling the career of their child, as she was aware of the mentality and  perception of her society. She wanted to avoid unnecessary stress because of her training and beginning of her career.. After two three days she changed her phone number in hope that he will forget her.</p>,<p>She was totally under estimating his love. His love was not just infatuation attraction. his love was from deep inside of heart, that was burning slowly from inside like a wick. That time in Diwali season he was sure, that she will definitely come to home. And that happened he went to wish Diwali. She understood the delicacy of matter and tried to make him understand but he was not ready to listen. At any cost he wanted to be with her. She was cursing herself for spoiling the future of a student. So she tried to explain practical things make told that if you will be lots of differences are there. Age gap, studies, they have to live in society. And other aspects. She will talk to him only if he can make his studies good and carrier like her. She was sure that it is a matter of few months and he will forget everything so she made a promise that if he will become a topper student she will talk him daily. But he has to prove himself and in between he will never try to talk to her. He thought for a while, agreed to the promise. He himself made a promise that he will talk to her, the day when he will be like her in respect of studies career. That day when she cannot make any excuses.</p>,<p>Few years passed she got transfer Tamilnadu after completion of training; and got busy with her bureaucratic job. She had no news of him, just forgotten him. Occasionally she visited her place in Kanpur and found no sign of him there. She was happy for her promise as she was sure that he had forgotten her. She thanked god that he saved her from committing a sin by destroying future of a child.</p>,<p>After accepting the promise, he began his studies as he knew that he has to get her back in his life he wanted to give his life a chance. He did not want to lose her at any cost, therefore he locked himself within a room full of books. Rarely went outside and following a strict timetable. He took readmission to school and started studies; came out with flying colors. Continued hard work, dedication, to beat her promise, to prove that his love will not come to an end until his death, . He will keep on loving that face, that name, that most cheerful smile throughout his life without any condition. But he had to fulfill her condition. After two failures,  finally cracked the same exam and got selection at the same post at hers. During last ten years, this was the first time he was extremely happy. Not because of his result because of keeping his promise fulfilling his condition for love.</p>,<p>In the meantime she got engaged to a well suitable boy found by her family members and was very happy. But her fate was also not suiting her. One day she met with an accident got seriously injured. She lost one of her leg, just after one week of engagement day. She had to pay double penalty of the accident by losing her feet and losing her trust on relationship as her fiancé returned the engagement ring. He cannot marry to a handicapped girl. After that incident she had a broken pieces of heart; got indulged in her job once again. As nothing good had remained in her life. She became a wick who was burning silently from inside, no cheerful smile, no beautiful face, within few months she turned into a skeleton, but one thing did not changed that was the light of her eyes.</p>,<p>He did not tried to contact her, did not met her in last eight years so was very curious to meet the lady of his dream and went to Kanpur. he took blessing of his mother first then enquired about the tuition teacher. She told everything what she had  faced in life.</p>,<p>He went to see her in her house and enquired about her wellbeing to her mother, she could not say anything and showed him the way to her room. There she was sitting on a wheel chair. He could not see his love in such a condition; eyes filled with tears. He was searching for the most beautiful face and most beautiful smile which he had left eight years back. She welcomed him and asked his whereabouts for last so many years and congratulated for his success in civil services. He could not say anything in response. Immediately he left the room.</p>,<p>For the next one week it was his routine to visit her place and to take care and to talk to her. This time he gathered some courage and proposed her he went down on the knee and said “Ithi ji, now all your conditions are fulfilled. I have kept all the promises you gave me. Will you marry me ?”</p>,<p>She was amazed to see the unconditional true love with such great affection, with such dedication,  this time she had the feeling being the luckiest person on earth to have person who loves her the most. She had the same feeling as he had, for the last ten years. She was feeling the pain and the joy of being in love. Her eyes started glowing like diamond with tears of joy inside. She was on the top of the paradise. <em>But next moment second thought overlapped her beautiful imaginations. She was his teacher. She considered him as his own son.</em> <em>That was the biggest sin in her opinion. How can she think of having such relationship with him?</em></p>,<p>Her heart felt with deep sorrows and guilty. She immediately asked him to forget her. If he really loves her, it would not make any difference whether he find her or not. Love is not merely getting someone you love. It is the most beautiful feeling you possess for whole of your life. She continued and told that she wanted a promise from him. He will never meet her in his life until and unless she will call; and requested him to leave. He had no other choices rather than to respect her decision and to keep the promise once again. He left the place deep heartedly loosing hopes. Left Kanpur for forever  and shifted to Mumbai to get back to work again.</p>,<p>After that he never tried to contact, to meet her, because he had to keep the promise. But he could never forget her beautiful face her cheerful smile, her innocent talks. Her name and her memories had become part of his life for forever. Each and everyday he used to get up in the hope of getting a call from his teacher. He had been waiting for a call from her for last few years. But that never happened.</p>,<p>&nbsp;</p>,<p>Now</p>,<p>He has been swimming in the ocean of memories of hers. His mother is crying and people in hospital are trying to console her. The doctor said “Sorry, He is no more,” “he had a severe heart attack”. No he did not die due to heart attack, he died due of the pain of broken pieces of a promise which he had been  keeping for the last five years. He died to meet his love, his first and true love, he died to meet his favourite teacher in heaven, he died to handed over the broken pieces of her promise to her. And he is ready to go to meet his love&#8230;</p>,<p>&#8211;END&#8211;</p>,<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div class="robots-nocontent sd-block sd-social sd-social-icon-text itemprop="headline">Searching The Shadows Of Her Soul In The Flood Fury</h1> ,<span class="alignleft"><img alt='' src='http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/72c17c45af045e87899c533040c3906b?s=85&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/72c17c45af045e87899c533040c3906b?s=170&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-85 photo' height='85' width='85' /></span><p class="entry-meta">English Short Story published on <time class="entry-time" itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2017-01-10T14:15:35+00:00">January 10, 2017</time> by <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/author/zubairudin-soibugh/" class="entry-author-link" itemprop="url" rel="author"><span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">zubairudin.soibugh</span></a></span> <div class="textwidget"><p><strong>Excerpt: </strong>His eyes finally twinkled when he had her SMS. A relieved mind and a soothing soul, Khurram could experience. A feeling consolidated deep within that she was fine. <strong>(Reads: 593)</strong> </p></div><section id="text-before-content-ad" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle"></div><div class="textwidget" style="margin-bottom:10px;"><!--AD START--><div style="text-align: center;">,<!-- YSC_RESP_2 -->,<ins class="adsbygoogle",     style="display:block",     data-ad-client="ca-pub-9888966704027314",     data-ad-slot="2044367786",     data-ad-format="auto"></ins>,<script>,(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});,</script>          ,            </div><!--AD END--></div></div></section><section id="text-before-content" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle">&nbsp;</div><div class="textwidget"></div></div><section></p></header><div class="entry-content" itemprop="text"><div id="attachment_14372" style="width: 460px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"><a href="http://i2.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/rain-drops.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-14372" src="http://i2.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/rain-drops.jpg?w=450" alt="rain-drops" srcset="http://i2.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/rain-drops.jpg?w=620 620w, http://i2.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/rain-drops.jpg?resize=300%2C225 300w" sizes="(max-width: 620px) 100vw, 620px" data-recalc-dims="1" /></a><p class="wp-caption-text">Love Short Story &#8211; Searching The Shadows Of Her Soul In The Flood Fury<br />Photo credit: <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/creative/hurley_gurlie182" rel="external nofollow">hurley_gurlie182</a> from <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/" rel="external nofollow">morguefile.com</a></p></div>,<p>After reacting out of proportion a feeling of regret overwhelmed Khurram.<br />,&#8220;How will I restore the lost confidence? &#8220;, Khurram quizzed himself.<br />,He felt a strange uneasiness. Weird thoughts began to frequent his mind.<br />,&#8221; I should not have reacted the way I did. She has never let me a reason to feel so. I am turning too selfish&#8221;, Khurram kept thinking!<br />,He was about to explode when his cell phone rang. Khurram didn&#8217;t care in the beginning and let the first call go unanswered.<br />,Again the phone rang. This time Khurram picked up the phone,<br />,&#8220;Oh! Faizan is calling &#8220;, He exclaimed!<br />,&#8221; His brother is getting engaged and he has invited us for a lunch today &#8220;, He recalled.<br />,Meanwhile it was heavily raining and it looked very bleak to attend the lunch at Faizans residence.<br />,&#8221; Sorry dear. I can&#8217;t come. It is raining terribly and there is skeletal transport out on the roads&#8221;, Khurram told him.<br />,However Faizan was not ready to listen to Khurrams logic and took a promise from him to have lunch along with the other friends at his residence. Khurram became a little puzzled.<br />,&#8220;What to do? &#8221;<br />,Khurram was just pondering over it that Baasit called him over phone and told him to manage till Kunzar. Shahid was coming in his car. Shortly after Imtiyaz too called and gave his accent for his participation. Khurram had the choice now.<br />,It was raining incessantly. It was raining the way it had never before. The elders at Khurrams home turned serious and began to talk about the looming floods. Even the ghost stories began to make rounds!<br />,He gave a slip and reached Kunzar.<br />,There was no one from his friends. The Sky was furious and rain drops fell like fires on the body. Everyone was taking refuge where ever he would find.<br />,A similar thought struck Khurrams mind.<br />,He entered the tea-stall and called for tea. While sipping tea Khurram looked outside. He had never imagined that he would feel scared by rain. Encounter with rain had, otherwise, always been thrilling for him. His preoccupation had shifted. In the early morning, He was obsessed with the guilt he felt while being rude to his friend, he simply adore!<br />,And now the rain was looking furious. There was concern reflecting from every face, sighs and involuntary prayers, while Khurram sipped the tea.<br />,His phone rang and Imtiyaz sought his location. Khurram boarded his car and in the meanwhile Shahid, too, arrived in his car. They left together and Shahid picked Baasit from Dhobivan.<br />,The discussion revolved around the rain and the possible danger at hand. However, Khurram had a reason to feel surprised.<br />,Imtiyaz was listening to (enjoying) the good old songs , he otherwise spurned !<br />,Further, the anticipation of yummy and luscious food shortly lightened their apprehensions. However at the back of Khurrams mind, his rudeness towards his friend was killing him inside. She had just told him not to sit idle and engage in some creative pursuits. Khurram maintained a calm composure, nevertheless.<br />,They reached Magam and were received by Faizan. They met the man of the occasion, Faizans brother, and were served the traditional &#8216;Kehwa&#8217; . A little chat and they were told to get ready for lunch.<br />,The lunch was served. It was more pleasing to senses than they had anticipated. Meanwhile the sky was pouring down its anger downwards.<br />,They hurried and got ready for departure.<br />,On their return they had a glimpse of the ferocious shape of water. The stream which passes through Magam was swelling with anger.<br />,Imtiyaz dropped Khurram at his home amidst the danger.<br />,And while Khurram returned to his room the early morning fiasco kept haunting him.<br />,&#8221; I have to be more reserved now and don&#8217;t let my worries and inner tussle be made public&#8221;, Khurram was trying to pacify his bewildered person.<br />,In the evening Khurram had a small chat with her. It seemed as if everything had changed.<br />,“The friend with whom I felt free to give vent to my feelings. A friend who turned to be a reason….. A friend with whom I wanted to script my destiny”.<br />,&#8220;Oh God! She is becoming a history for me now &#8220;.<br />,Khurram felt a metamorphosis. Khurram didn&#8217;t sleep well that night. However in the last quarter of that night Khurram had her in his dream.<br />,A satisfaction descended upon him.<br />,“Yes I had overreacted. I have perhaps not swallowed the fact of her eventual departure from me. My heart is still not ready to look beyond Her”.<br />,Khurram was in a predicament. He had to make the choice. Over the years, Khurram had nurtured an intense longing for Her. He had, nevertheless, learned a blink of sacrifice.<br />,&#8220;you have to sacrifice your longing! Khurram &#8220;, Khurram addressed himself.<br />,His throat felt parched with this very thought. The whole day He wavered between one extreme and the other.<br />,It should not have been so difficult.<br />,&#8221; I am unable to bear this agony&#8221;, Khurram said so sobbingly but silently!<br />,Meanwhile the social media became abuzz with the emerging floods. More than 60 people who had accompanied a groom were washed away in Rajouri in the flash floods.<br />,Again, Khurram had a little chat with her that evening. But a feeling descended upon Khurram that She is more happy without him .<br />,&#8220;I only turn a reason for a shift in her mood towards feeling perturbed&#8221;.<br />,&#8220;I should rein in myself and try to learn ethics. Be more mature &#8220;.<br />,Khurram decided to tender apology from her the next day. It was Friday.<br />,Saturday saw South Kashmir submerged. Radio Kashmir was broadcasting live the happenings across Kashmir. The social media was overwhelmed with the desperate calls for help and rescue.<br />,In the evening the chief engineer came live on radio. When he mentioned about the devastation in the villages of South Kashmir, Khurram became afraid for his friend namely Mustafa . He dialled his number several times but to no avail.<br />,Kurram called Mohsin (his another friend) and enquired about the safety of Mustafa.<br />,&#8220;Oh My Lord! Shazia (Mohsins fiancée) and her family are in serious danger. Help and save them. And also save Mustafa&#8221;, Khurram felt desperate.<br />,But to the surprise&#8217; of Khurram she visited him in his dream again even though, at least, that night Khurram had no reason to host her in his dream!<br />,The predicament of Mustafa and Shazia had overwhelmed Khurram while he had fallen asleep.<br />,Next day was Sunday.<br />,And it turned out to be the most disturbing in the evolving scenario. The anchors in the live programme on radio Kashmir could be heard trembling. And when Taahir, one of the anchors, left the studio midway to save his children only to find himself trapped enroute his home, one could have an idea of the urgency of the situation.<br />,Mohammad Afaan,the chief anchor, made repeated requests to save his friend and colleague. So did he with regard to others.<br />,And then when Mohammad Afaan bid goodbye to his listeners, the panic increased. There was a terrifying silence. Meanwhile rumours kept circulating about the devastation the floods were causing.<br />,&#8220;Two stories or more are submerged, O My Lord&#8221;!<br />,Khurram could only sigh.<br />,Khurram began worrying about her. His concern for South Kashmir friends was overshadowed by her well-being. Khurram started dialling her number.<br />,No! It didn&#8217;t work.<br />,He sent her a few messages but to no avail.<br />,There was an increased palpitation. But He had to keep his composure intact.<br />,Suddenly Khurram heard a rescue team had left to evacuate the stranded labours of his native village in Bemina, Srinagar. He started dialling the number of Umar, his relative, and one of the members of the rescue team, but Khurram found it only out of reach. Back home in his native village, Lalpora, the water level was increasing monstrously and so the wailing of women and sighs of the old folks was quite natural.<br />,Tension mounted with each passing moment. All sorts of rumours kept circulating. There was no information about the rescue team of Lalpora . Meanwhile evening descended. The elders, especially those whose kiths and kins had left for Bemina, were a worried lot. A few began to narrate the ghost stories!<br />,Khurram had never seen the panic of this magnitude. Even those who otherwise were very strong began to faint. At the back of the mind, nevertheless, Khurram was concerned about her and a number of weird thoughts frequented his cranium.<br />,&#8220;When shall we meet and talk again&#8221;?<br />,&#8220;I have to apologize her&#8221;.<br />,It went on.<br />,Khurram would flip through the conversations he had with her.<br />,&#8221; Can I be back at my best&#8221;?<br />,Khurram quizzed himself!<br />,In the end all he could manage were a few words,<br />,&#8220;My lord have mercy on us. Keep her and all those who left Lalpora in your protection. Keep everyone safe&#8221;.<br />,There was an uneasy calm. Khurram had a reason to be more disturbed. His close relative was a part of the rescue team.<br />,It was 11 pm that the two tippers arrived. The rescue team arrived with the stranded labours.<br />,There were hugs. They had a reason to celebrate.<br />,After hearing about the flood fury, Khurram asked his relative, &#8220;Is Maisuma, Srinagar safe&#8221;?<br />,&#8221; What are you saying. It is deluge in Srinagar &#8220;, was his reply.<br />,Khurram murmured a few words.<br />,Even though the mobile networks had almost ceased to function, still Khurram dialled her number a number of times.<br />,Sheer frustration!<br />,He couldn&#8217;t tell anybody his predicament.<br />,The natives of Lalpora didn&#8217;t sleep that night as water level was increasing every hour. There was red alert declared.<br />,Next morning, the natives had to keep themselves busy with evacuating their fellow people in and around Lalpora.<br />,The scenes are beyond the scope of description.<br />,The day passed off. There was no news from Srinagar. A few rumours made people believe that thousands have died.<br />,&#8220;How could I get to know about her&#8221;? Khurram felt choked inside.<br />,Next day water level came down in Lalpora and so many people left for the different parts of Srinagar.<br />,Khurram insisted, against the initial plan of other accompanying people, that they will visit Maisuma.<br />,They drove towards Maisuma.<br />,There was destruction everywhere.<br />,Khurram could well imagine the trouble she would be in.<br />,But there was a silver lining.<br />,Khurram talked to a few people there who were confident in their assertion that there was no major human loss.<br />,A sigh of relief!<br />,A tender smile!</p>,<p>Meanwhile a few boats were roving on the waters and Khurram only fumed at not knowing her exact place of residence.<br />,“This was a close call. I could have reached and get to know about her”, Khurram said to himself.<br />,Alas! It didn&#8217;t happen.<br />,Nevertheless Khurram enquired about the water level and the condition of people in her area.<br />,On hearing the reply, He felt a little contended.<br />,Another day passed.<br />,Khurram could not believe himself. His mind and heart were fixed on her. Apparently he would feel strong but inside he was dying to hear from her.<br />,&#8220;What kinda feeling this is? What sort of relationship I have with her? It is much more than loving her &#8220;. Khurram was lost in her bewitching and captivating persona.<br />,His only solace was seeking the mercy of Lord.<br />,&#8221; O Lord, keep her and her family in your protection &#8220;.<br />,His finger always strolled on her number.<br />,The next day there was some sort of network in his cell phone. His first reaction was getting excited.<br />,&#8221; I am very close to reaching her now &#8220;!<br />,Khurram started dialling her number. Alas! His efforts proved a failure.<br />,He then sent a number of messages but He again had to embrace disappointment.<br />,There was dejection and despair.<br />,Khurrams heart was brimming with an intense longing to see her again.<br />,He started murmuring,<br />,&#8220;My dear, I have been rude to you. I have been very indecent. I have reacted often out of proportion. But the love and care I have for you is unfathomable! All I want at this time is to get in touch with you &#8220;!<br />,Perhaps it was the biggest ordeal of his life. His longest wait!<br />,There was a strange stirring beneath the physical appearance of Khurram. He looked upwards and would find the stars tumbling upon him.<br />,There was desperation. There was distress. He was growing mad. The irony with Khurram was that he couldn&#8217;t tell anyone his predicament.<br />,&#8220;let no one encounter the ordeal of this kind&#8221;, he sighed.<br />,The feeling was indeed overwhelming. Khurram kept dialing her number. Upon being asked by the onlookers, He would answer that he was trying to reach out to his relatives and friends. Yes Khurram made a few calls to them also.<br />,Finally Khurram had a call from her but he missed it. He fainted in excitement. Weird thoughts came in his mind as he had missed her call. Khurram began calling her but to no avail which enhanced his frustration manifold.<br />,He kept calling her till late night and it continued the next day. While Khurram failed in his attempt to reach her via phone, He began checking the figures.<br />,Yes. Khurram had dialled her number more than 800 times in less than three days!<br />,His eyes finally twinkled when he had her SMS. A relieved mind and a soothing soul, Khurram could experience. A feeling consolidated deep within that she was fine.<br />,Soon Khurram managed to talk to her over phone. It was altogether a different feeling. A bliss!<br />,And then when Khurram returned to normal state of mind, his heart tried to intrude again his conscience.<br />,&#8220;Why can&#8217;t you be only mine, my dear&#8221;?<br />,&#8220;I am caught in muck. I can&#8217;t afford to stay away from you. The very thought of losing you is terrifying. &#8221;<br />,Yes, very soon she is heading for her conjugal journey with the prince charming but Khurram has the faith that she will always press her delicate hands in service to steer him towards stability!</p>,<p>&#8211;END&#8211;<br />,Mohd Zubair Ud Din</p>,<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div class="robots-nocontent sd-block DATE</span></span></span></span></span></div><article class="post-172565 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-short-stories-love tag-college tag-first-date tag-girlfriend tag-first-kiss-stories tag-love tag-school entry" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting" itemprop="blogPost"><header class="entry-header"><h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">MY FIRST DATE</h1> ,<span class="alignleft"><img alt='' src='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6df26e00baca46a2e0716944fc3ab28b?s=85&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6df26e00baca46a2e0716944fc3ab28b?s=170&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-85 photo' height='85' width='85' /></span><p class="entry-meta">English Short Story published on <time class="entry-time" itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2017-01-10T13:43:00+00:00">January 10, 2017</time> by <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/author/jaseem-ck/" class="entry-author-link" itemprop="url" rel="author"><span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">JC</span></a></span> <div class="textwidget"><p><strong>Excerpt: </strong>Then I recited those magical words, "I LOVE YOU Divya, more than anyone....". And now she was amazed.Now she looks more beautiful. She came closer. I too made a step forth. <strong>(Reads: 521)</strong> </p></div><section id="text-before-content-ad" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle"></div><div class="textwidget" style="margin-bottom:10px;"><!--AD START--><div style="text-align: center;">,<!-- YSC_RESP_LINK2 -->,<ins class="adsbygoogle",     style="display:block",     data-ad-client="ca-pub-9888966704027314",     data-ad-slot="8260256186",     data-ad-format="link"></ins>,<script>,(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});,</script>          ,            </div><!--AD END--></div></div></section><section id="text-before-content" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle">&nbsp;</div><div class="textwidget"></div></div><section></p></header><div class="entry-content" itemprop="text"><div id="attachment_32242" style="width: 460px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"><a href="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/coffee-beans-love.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-32242" src="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/coffee-beans-love.jpg?w=450" alt="coffee-beans-love" srcset="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/coffee-beans-love.jpg?w=620 620w, http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/coffee-beans-love.jpg?resize=300%2C261 300w" sizes="(max-width: 620px) 100vw, 620px" data-recalc-dims="1" /></a><p class="wp-caption-text">Romantic Short Story &#8211; MY FIRST DATE<br />Photo credit: <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/creative/godidwlr" rel="external nofollow">godidwlr</a> from <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/" rel="external nofollow">morguefile.com</a></p></div>,<p>&#8220;Here, have your coffee..&#8221;said mom.</p>,<p>Her face has glittered up a little more today. Mothers are the one to be most proud of their son&#8217;s achievements. I don&#8217;t know whether it&#8217;s because their son&#8217;s achieve so big or people see their son&#8217;s achieve so big. I am graduated from IIT Delhi and is placed in an MNC recently. And today it&#8217;s our high school get-together and people are going to see how much her son has grown up.What more for a mother to be proud of?</p>,<p>I drink the coffee, every drop of it with not even a drop stuck spread on my lips. The coffee tastes good with the daily newspaper. This is one of the habit i am addicted to. It&#8217;s eight now. I got to be at the school by 9:30.<br />,I am looking forward to see all my friends.I had contact with most of them.Some of them accompanied me in my higher secondary studies too.But there&#8217;s always one special person whom you are waiting to see in a get-together. One whom with you didn&#8217;t have any direct meetings after farewell, one whose facebook status was always been checked by you,whose whatsapp &#8216;last seen&#8217; was always noticed by you.One who got apart after those days, but never from your heart.Yeah!for me, she is that special person.</p>,<p>&#8220;Oh!it&#8217;s nine.I am late.Mom, iron my blue shirt.The one with white stripes.Fast&#8230;&#8221;,I uttered.</p>,<p>&#8220;It&#8217;s a special day for all of us.I am happy to see all of you to have grown so big.I couldn&#8217;t even some of you with beards and thick moustaches. And&#8230;..&#8221;,Hari sir continued.<br />,I regret to have shaven my beard and moustache. Even he has changed a lot.His hair is now balded and fully white.His skin has wrinkles everywhere.Actually everyone is different now.Some of the girls are even married.That add to my worries.Everyone is facing the stage.I am also facing Hari sir.But my eyes were searching for Divya-my special person.She is nowhere.The optimist in me says,&#8217;She is coming soon, relax&#8230;&#8217; and the pessimist says,&#8217;yeah, coming with a baby in her hands and a body-builder husband&#8221;.</p>,<p>Nothing happened for a while, for a long while.Anything must have changed.But something never changes. Hari sir is still making his lectures with assumptions,contradictions and proof.And the students are sleeping with their eyes closed.After sometime a person with a camera tied to his neck said something in his ears. Hari sir made his same old grin which says, &#8216;i am just getting warmed up&#8217; when there exists a mob who believes there&#8217;s a dawn after every dark night.But fortunately he conclude his small lecture(which costs us an hour of our &#8216;special day&#8217;) and instruct us to get line up for a photoshoot. Shall i ask someone what happened to Divya.I don&#8217;t know.She probably must be pregnant and dreaming of a happy family with a cute baby.Come on, don&#8217;t say that.I don&#8217;t want that to happen.</p>,<p>We are arranged the same way we were arranged in the farewell photo shoot. No one noticed a lean girl&#8217;s vacancy.But it was wide enough for me.All of a sudden a car appear coming towards us.Everyone&#8217;s glares shift to the car.The swift car parked in the centre of the playground.It resembles the hero of a film making his entry.The door is push open.And there comes the hero, with a thick moustache,white beard,fit body probably in his 50-s.And film or not, there come&#8217;s my heroine-Divya. Sometimes the hero i mentioned before gonna end up to be the villain of my story-Divya&#8217;s father.</p>,<p>&#8220;Divya,yeah!that&#8217;s Divya&#8221;, all those girls shriek and usher her to her place in the arrangement.And all those boys start talking about her beauty,her walking and what not.But for me in her presence, even the breeze feel special.I glared at her throughout the section until i was disrupted by the camera&#8217;s flashlight.Everyone check out the photo.My eyes were pointed to Divya. No one must have noticed.However in a photo of 40 people confined in a 15*40 border,who&#8217;s going to notice my tiny eyes.Everyone show a thumps-up to the photographer.<br />,My heart started beating faster.I proposed her numerous times in my dreams.Can i do it at least once in real.Who knows?&#8230;..</p>,<p>&#8220;Hai&#8221;, i said counting the number of holes in the microphone.One of the most interesting(boredom) section of a get-together &#8211; student&#8217;s get a chance to speak about themselves.I open my adventurous biography.It is a good one with entrance exams, IIT, medal, ranks, placement and a whole lot more stuff.And you know what i lead first in the list of perfect grooms in my batch.The girls are like,&#8221;wow,some more&#8230;.&#8221; and the boys are like,&#8221;What&#8217;s the deal man, cut it off&#8221;.Everyone had their chance but no one had taken this time to introduce the &#8216;new&#8217; them.After each speech a challenge is given to them.some got to say never to make a lecture again to Hari sir, some were made to imitate dogs,cats&#8230;As for me, for Mr Perfect, it is to say &#8216;I LOVE YOU&#8217; to some girl in the class.</p>,<p>I am still there.I am not taking time to select someone.It is either Divya or no one.But i don&#8217;t want to say that like this, not now.I have to come up with something.<br />,&#8220;Nope, i can&#8217;t&#8221;, i said.<br />,&#8220;Come on, choose anyone randomly.&#8221;, said Radhika.<br />,&#8220;sorry&#8230;&#8221;, i said.<br />,&#8220;why?&#8221;, Shahina asked.<br />,&#8220;I don&#8217;t want to disappoint the rest of the girls.&#8221;, i replied.<br />,Everyone laugh.I am not very humorous but i was then. Divya laugh the most.I am looking at her like we are the only people in that room.<br />,&#8220;No more jokes.come on, do it siddharth&#8230;&#8221;, Divya said.<br />,&#8220;Then show me how to&#8230;.&#8221; ,i said.<br />,&#8220;I LOVE YOU&#8221;, she said in a second.<br />,She said she love you, come on siddhu don&#8217;t just stand there.My mind started dancing and running all around the room.After half a minute of silence i replied,&#8221;Same to you&#8221;.<br />,And then everyone burst into laughter.</p>,<p>The cake was delicious.But it won&#8217;t look delicious if pasted in your face.I am in the wash room.I wash my face.Maybe i have to reconsider, the cake looks yummy and tastes yummy, i said to myself licking the essence flowing down my face..I comb my hair and disguise again into Mr Perfect.I walk aiming our classroom.I can see Divya coming, coming to me.Oh!no, her eyes were powerful enough to make me slumber which is filled with beautiful dreams.She gave me a cover.I was still checking out her eyes.<br />,&#8220;Open it&#8221;, She said.<br />,I obeyed her just like a son responds to his stick carrying father.It was a card.Is it a love letter or something?There was a picture of god Ganapathi. Underneath in bold letters &#8216;Mr Balakrishnan and Vasantha Balakrishnan invites you&#8217;.That was an invitation card.<br />,&#8220;Next week&#8221;, she said.<br />,It was all over,all those dreams, all those days, everything.I tried my best not to show my emotions in my face.But i am not strong enough to make a fake &#8216;congrats&#8217; or &#8216;all the best&#8217;.<br />,&#8220;Do you love me?&#8221;, she asked.<br />,I was startled.My heart stopped working then, so as my vocal chords.No one spoke.<br />,&#8220;I do all these years.But never said.I thought you too&#8230;sorry, leave it.After each year you have grown high, out of my reach.And you cared no one.You just run behind your dreams, your weird dreams of IIT&#8217;s, IIM&#8217;s and MNC&#8217;s&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;.sorry&#8221;,She said breaking the silence.</p>,<p>After a minute of just heartbeats, a drop of tear fell from her right eye.I never thought she had feelings for me.She slowly walked away from me.<br />,&#8220;I am sorry, i am going home.And should come for my sister&#8217;s marriage.&#8221;, she said.</p>,<p>Sister.Sister&#8217;s marriage.I never thought art students can come up with such suspense thriller.You can analyse this later,siddhu. Boys should have taken initiative which is &#8216;you&#8217; here.But she did it.Now at least co-operate with her.I ran to her with every feet wide as i can.She looked back.I am breathing heavy.<br />,&#8220;What?&#8221;, she asked.<br />,I said,&#8221;Yes!i have weird dreams.But in all my dreams you were with me, always.&#8221;<br />,Then i recited those magical words, &#8220;I LOVE YOU Divya, more than anyone&#8230;.&#8221;<br />,And now she was amazed.Now she looks more beautiful.<br />,She came closer.I too made a step forth.Her lips looks like a fresh slice of mango, smells like sandal and it may taste like honey too.We closed our eyes.The heart that was stopped 2 minutes before was now running fast as it could.Our heads collide.She tilt her head a bit.And i could feel that was going to happen&#8230;.<br />,&#8220;Divya, your father is here&#8221;, Hari sir shouted from the other side.<br />,I can still feel her breath.And it repeats&#8217;I love you&#8217;.<br />,&#8220;Will you come to &#8216;coffebean&#8217; at eleven tomorrow morning.&#8221;, she asked.<br />,I would like to say &#8216;anything, everything.But instead i said an O.K.<br />,She left the scene, but not me.I replayed the scene again and again.But there&#8217;s a little change. Hari sir has never been born to earth.</p>,<p>&#8220;Will you be my girl&#8221;, i said for the sixth time in front of the mirror improvising each time.I wore a black t-shirt and a jeans.I bought a ring just for her which cost half my pocket money.My grooming programme gone up to 2 hours.I went downstairs.My father was reading the newspaper.<br />,&#8220;People these days are so careless.It will cost them their life itself.It happened in the next junction.A father and his daughter was dead.Look at the trashed car.It&#8217;s a new swift car. Siddhu,take care.You should be very careful while driving.&#8221;, he said.<br />,My father seems to be more sad for the car than the persons who were dead in the accident.Actually i was always the first one to read the daily news.But not today..<br />,I went to my father&#8217;s room.They had a bigger mirror.I never noticed it until now.I t was so unfair.I made the finishing touch.I said to myself,&#8217;Come on siddhu, this is no America and this is not your first date.&#8217;<br />,&#8220;Where are you going?&#8221;, mom stopped in the middle of nowhere and added,&#8221;You looks good today&#8221;.<br />,I don&#8217;t know why but i kissed her and said,&#8221;I am going to my friend&#8217;s home.Will be back in an hour&#8221;.<br />,I waved her bye.<br />,I took my father&#8217;s Activa,which i would never prescribe to use for one&#8217;s first date.&#8217;Didn&#8217;t you leave it.It&#8217;s not your first date,siddhu.&#8217;<br />,I was there by 10:30 but entered the coffee shop by 11:10 only.I don&#8217;t want to be the one waiting,i wanted to be the one being waited.But she wasn&#8217;t there.I ordered two coffees.<br />,It&#8217;s about 12 and is not here yet.Has she gone from my life foreever? or whatever happened yesterday was just a dream?I don&#8217;t know.There&#8217;s a newspaper on the next table.I took it in the intention to kill the time till my queen comes.<br />,My phone is vibrating&#8230;&#8221;Unknown number&#8221;.<br />,&#8220;Hello, Is this Siddharth?&#8221;,it was Divya.<br />,&#8220;Yes, it is Siddharth speaking and sitting in &#8216;coffeebean&#8217; as ordered by his lover Miss Divya.&#8221;, i replied.<br />,She giggled and said,&#8221;You should change your whatsapp DP.&#8221;<br />,So that&#8217;s how she got my number.<br />,&#8220;So, that&#8217;s why you called me.&#8221;, i asked.<br />,&#8220;I am sorry.I can&#8217;t reach there now.All my cousin&#8217;s are here.Can&#8217;t escape now&#8221;,she said.<br />,I was mad at her but i said,&#8221;That&#8217;s all right, see you in the wedding&#8221; because i know then that the two of us have a whole life time before us to quarrel, resolve, love and to quarrel again&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;.</p>,<p>&#8211;END&#8211;</p>,<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div class="robots-nocontent sd-block sd-social sd-social-icon-text sd-sharing"><h3 xmlns:v="http://rdf.data-vocabulary.org/#"><span typeof="v:Breadcrumb"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com" rel="v:url" property="v:title">yourstoryclub</a> &raquo; <span rel="v:child" (1)</span></span></span></span></span></div><article class="post-172532 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-short-stories-love tag-beautiful tag-death tag-touching-stories-poems-mother tag-smile tag-teacher entry" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting" itemprop="blogPost"><header class="entry-header"><h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">Broken pieces of a promise (1)</h1> ,<span class="alignleft"><img alt='' src='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6ca2170aee5dff0dd422a940d62cb082?s=85&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6ca2170aee5dff0dd422a940d62cb082?s=170&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-85 photo' height='85' width='85' /></span><p class="entry-meta">English Short Story published on <time class="entry-time" itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2017-01-09T13:50:26+00:00">January 9, 2017</time> by <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/author/sejal/" class="entry-author-link" itemprop="url" rel="author"><span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">sejal</span></a></span> <div class="textwidget"><p><strong>Excerpt: </strong>Whole night he was dreaming about that patting hand on his back and cheerful smiling face. Now he had two faces one happy face for result and another side very sad as he will not be able to see his favorite teacher.  <strong>(Reads: 367)</strong> </p></div><section id="text-before-content-ad" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle"></div><div class="textwidget" style="margin-bottom:10px;"><!--AD START--><div style="text-align: center;">,<!-- YSC_RESP_LINK2 -->,<ins class="adsbygoogle",     style="display:block",     data-ad-client="ca-pub-9888966704027314",     data-ad-slot="8260256186",     data-ad-format="link"></ins>,<script>,(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});,</script>          ,            </div><!--AD END--></div></div></section><section id="text-before-content" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle">&nbsp;</div><div class="textwidget"></div></div><section></p></header><div class="entry-content" itemprop="text"><div id="attachment_13278" style="width: 460px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"><a href="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-13278" src="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg?w=450" alt="dry-flower-stones" srcset="http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg?w=620 620w, http://i1.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/dry-flower-stones.jpg?resize=300%2C199 300w" sizes="(max-width: 620px) 100vw, 620px" data-recalc-dims="1" /></a><p class="wp-caption-text">Love Short Story &#8211; Broken pieces of a promise (1)<br />Photo credit: <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/creative/solrac_gi_2nd" rel="nofollow external">solrac_gi_2nd</a> from <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/" rel="nofollow external">morguefile.com</a></p></div>,<p>In our life sometime such situations come, when we are not able to stop our tears falling from eyes irrespective of place where we are and position at which we are. If they have decided to leave our eyes, it is impossible to hold them. In such situations our endless efforts does make it. Today, same situation arise in his life, when his own eyes, his own tears are not obeying him; his tears are ready to roll down through cheeks and want to fall on barren land of thoughts.</p>,<p>After concluding the budget meeting held, prior to budget session on most critical revenue issues being part of his bureaucratic job, he gave a at his phone, it showed six missed calls. All were from his mother’s number and that was enough to make him tensed. He immediately left the conference hall and moved towards his cabin. While sitting on the chair he dialed his mother’s number.</p>,<p>“Haan Maa. Tell me, what is the urgent matter”</p>,<p>Mother replied “Chirag beta gajab ho gaya.”</p>,<p>“What happened Maa? Hope everything is fine there.” He asked, showing concern towards his dear mother.</p>,<p>“We are all right, nothing happened to us.” On hearing that he took a sigh of relief.</p>,<p>Mother continued “Do  you remember the tuition teacher in our neighborhood in Kanpur who taught you Math and Chemistry in tenth standard?  She had taught to your sister too.”</p>,<p>He suddenly slipped into the river of thoughts on hearing the word tuition teacher, remembering the name and face of that girl. How can he forget that girl, how can he forget that face? Within few seconds overcame from all thoughts, came to the present;  he has to make his mother unaware of all these thoughts.</p>,<p>He acted “Maa I don’t remember? What was the name?”</p>,<p>Even in the most unconscious stage of  mind, he could have told that name, the name which had been attached to his breathe. The name from which he had been getting inspiration, motivation, and strength. Everything belongs to him begins with that name. The name itself has the meaning &#8220;the beginning&#8221;. He had not forgotten that name and face for the last fifteen years and his mother asked “Do you remember that girl; that name?” Any way, he acted that if he was the least bother person.</p>,<p>His mother continued telling the most disastrous incident and told that the lady Ithi is no more, she died a week back. Without giving ear to other words, he lost all of his consciousness and strength at once. His phone slide off from hand and fell down on table. His legs started trembling. He just dragged himself till the point where couch was lying inside rest room section of the cabin.</p>,<p>Mother was saying hello…hello…hello. From this side, there was no response at all. A silence had been scattered over the room. A stream of tears started flowing from his eyes which was resting there for the last fifteen years. He wondered, why his heartbeats have not stopped, why blood is still flowing through veins and lost into an ocean of memories, left behind.</p>,<p>FIFTEEN  YEARS BACK</p>,<p>Chirag came from school and was very upset as the result of half yearly exam had been declared same day… he could not make two papers clear. He had no hopes no dreams about his future…just wanted to clear all papers. He was not interested in studies at all. Any how he wanted to go to next class. His father enquired about the result and he showed the report card. His father consulted with his mother and they decided to send him for private tuition. One of his friend suggested that there is very efficient teacher in their neighborhood and his own daughter used to go to that tuition class. They decided to send him to that teacher for tuition class. As he was very shy, not willing to go for tuition class, mother convinced him.</p>,<p>Next day  evening he went unwillingly to class for the first time alongwith his mother. His mother introduced him to the teacher. Teacher, the most beautiful girl with most beautiful smile, he had seen in his life so far. Long hair roughly tied in a knot, pink and green colored pattern churidar set, simple yet elegant. Her lustful eyes were blinking like lighted earthen lamp. Her presence soothed his senses. Students used to call her Ithi didi. Didi means “elder sister”.</p>,<p>He did not want to call her Ithi didi so he called her Ithi ji in similar manner that sounds  “Ithi didi”. when  she was talking to his mother, he was just staring at her, she noticed and told him to sit and open his books, pointing on an empty chair. That was an embarrassing moment. He did not want to make a bad impression. But  those words really appeared unforgettable melodious music to his ears. That was the first interaction  with his tuition teacher. Already there were five more students studying in that room. She was very polite. She was the best teacher he had seen, her way of teaching was very different from other teachers. She never got angry to her students. Once she started defining things every doubt of student will be cleared.</p>,<p>At the time of class he started paying special attention. He found her very knowledgeable in her subject of teaching. He was very happy to have such a nice teacher in his life. He kept on waiting eagerly for tuition class. To impress the teacher he started working hard on studies, within two months with  hard work and dedication (<em>dedication to impress tuition teacher</em>) he was among the top rank holders in his class at school.</p>,<p>He scored a decent score in his tenth class exam which he had never expected. He went to show his result card to his tuition teacher. He hit on the door bell, as she opened the door, he showed his marksheet and could not say a single word. After examining the marksheet she congratulated and patted on his back. That day he felt himself on the seventh sky of joy. Whole night he was dreaming about that patting hand on his back and cheerful smiling face. Now he had two faces one happy face for result and another side very sad as he will not be able to see his favorite teacher. Daily in the evening he used to go on terrace in the expectation to see the face of his teacher. Sometimes he succeeded in his mission, sometimes he did not.</p>,<p>Days were passing.  His family members planned to go to his village in summer vacation for one month. He gave many excuses for not going but all became futile. He had to visit his mother’s place too. That period of one month seems hundred years. Every now and then he wanted to come back to Kanpur. Now he realized that he cannot live without seeing her. Her cheerful smile was fresh air in the morning to him. He was missing her a lot. Earlier, whatever things gave him happiness and pleasure, those became meaning less. He kept on thinking about only one name one face, his tuition teacher’s face. May be he was in love. Yes…innocent first love or something like “Love at first sight”.</p>,<p><strong>&#8212;</strong></p>,<p><strong>(To be continued…)</strong></p>,<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div xmlns:v="http://rdf.data-vocabulary.org/#"><span typeof="v:Breadcrumb"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com" rel="v:url" property="v:title">yourstoryclub</a> &raquo; <span rel="v:child" Story..!!!</span></span></span></span></span></div><article class="post-172496 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-short-stories-love tag-cancer tag-happiness tag-love tag-together entry" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting" itemprop="blogPost"><header class="entry-header"><h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">A Sad Love Story..!!!</h1> ,<span class="alignleft"><img alt='' src='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/05174cd9d7718e77172c0c5deb2e0c44?s=85&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/05174cd9d7718e77172c0c5deb2e0c44?s=170&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-85 photo' height='85' width='85' /></span><p class="entry-meta">English Short Story published on <time class="entry-time" itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2017-01-07T13:58:16+00:00">January 7, 2017</time> by <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/author/ruqsar/" class="entry-author-link" itemprop="url" rel="author"><span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">Ruqsar</span></a></span> <div class="textwidget"><p><strong>Excerpt: </strong>Aizwal couldn't controlled her emotions and hugged Rehan . And they promised each  other until they are alive, They will be together and happy. <strong>(Reads: 719)</strong> </p></div><section id="text-before-content-ad" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle"></div><div class="textwidget" style="margin-bottom:10px;"><!--AD START--><div style="text-align: center;">,<!-- YSC_RESP_LINK1 -->,<ins class="adsbygoogle",     style="display:block",     data-ad-client="ca-pub-9888966704027314",     data-ad-slot="3830056582",     data-ad-format="link"></ins>,<script>,(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});,</script>          ,            </div><!--AD END--></div></div></section><section id="text-before-content" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle">&nbsp;</div><div class="textwidget"></div></div><section></p></header><div class="entry-content" itemprop="text"><p>It was during Winter&#8230;. Aizwal thought of going out alone for sometime, so that she could spend sometime alone. She was frustrated with her life. Guess what Aizwal found????<br />,She found a cute Bella(A dog) Aizwal took Bella in her arm and walked away.<br />,While walking! She met a young handsome boy who was also walking alone on street.<br />,Aizwal got his attention, he came towards her and asked.<br />,Do You also like to walk alone on street???<br />,Aizwal: Ignored<br />,Rehan: I am talking to you, &#8220;My name is Rehan and i am from Mumbai&#8221;.<br />,Aizwal: Again ignored him , and just walked away silently.<br />,Rehan: Hey! Why are you ignoring me ? Don&#8217;t you like me&#8221;??<br />,Aizwal: Smiled and said, No it&#8217;s not like that. &#8220;I just avoid talking to strangers&#8221;.<br />,Rehan: Come on, I am not bad company at all. You can trust me. See i also like staying alone and you are also same  like me. Can i walk with you? I hope you don&#8217;t mind.<br />,Aizwal: Yea.. hmm mm. Ok you can<br />,Rehan:: &#8220;Can i ask you something&#8221;?<br />,Aizwal: &#8220;Yes&#8221;, You can&#8230;<br />,Rehan: &#8220;What else you&#8217;d like to do&#8221;? Like apart from walking alone on street,,<br />,Aizwal: ***Silent for a couple of second****<br />,Hmmmm well , &#8220;I like walking in rain, Painting and travelling&#8221;&#8230;. Anywayz time to go now, Bye&#8230;<br />,Rehan: But&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;Ok&#8230; Listen can we meet tomorrow at same place.<br />,Aizwal: &#8220;Not Sure&#8221;.<br />,And she walked away from Rehan.<br />,Rehan was watching her continously  that she will turn and look at him once.  But she didn&#8217;t look at him<br />,The next day rehan was waiting for Aizwal. He was confident enough that she will come today. He looked at his watch . He thought of going back then he saw someone is coming and it was aizwal itself. He was so much happy because rehan was Love at first sight with Aizwal. She was looking gorgeous in her skirt , blue eyes and her lips which attracted him the most.<br />,Again the conversation started between Aizwal and Rehan<br />,So, Finally you came . &#8220;Tell me your name atleast&#8221;, Rehan asked Aizwal<br />,Aizwal: My name is Aizwal<br />,Rehan: Nice Name<br />,They both walked together for long, they both didn&#8217;t say a word each other. Rehan was looking at Aizwal, But Aizwal didn&#8217;t notice.<br />,Rehan started the conversation<br />,So, Ms Aizwal what do you do in your spare time?<br />,Aizwal: Ummmm.. I am a teacher in St. Georges school, It is a primary school. I love spending time with childrens because childrens don&#8217;t hurt people intentionally like how adults actual do.<br />,Rehan:  Well, I agree with you. But, &#8220;May i know the reason of your sadness&#8221;?<br />,Aizwal: Nothing Important.. It&#8217;s just like i had so many dreams to fulfill, But&#8230;. Have no time&#8230;&#8230;.<br />,Rehan: What? Please tell me clearly.<br />,Aizwal: Ummm, Nothing. Let&#8217;s go back<br />,Rehan: &#8220;Stop Aizwal&#8221; . You can&#8217;t go like this.<br />,Aizwal: Leave my hand rehan and let me go. It&#8217;s about my life . You don&#8217;t need to interfere in it life. So stay away from me.<br />,Next Day<br />,Rehan is searching  Aizwal because he has to talk to her, He has to say Aizwal about his feelings about his love at first sight . He searched her everywhere in the nearby areas. At last he found her in a market buying groceries .<br />,He secretly went behind her and followed her till she reached her home.<br />,He was waiting Aizwal to come out of her home, so that he can talk to her about yesterday.<br />,He waited sooo long&#8230;&#8230; But Aizwal didn&#8217;t come.<br />,Suddenly Aizwal came out of her home for a walk. She saw Rehan standing out .<br />,She ignored and started walking away from him.<br />,Rehan: Please Stop Aizwal ,  I need to talk to you,<br />,Aizwal: Stop following me Rehan and just go away from here.<br />,Rehan: Ran towards her and catch her hand and asked, &#8220;Why are you ignoring me&#8221;. You don&#8217;t know, How much I love you Aizwal, Please don&#8217;t do like this.<br />,Aizwal was trying to free herself from Rehan,<br />,Aizwal: Rehan, Leave me&#8230;.. &#8220;What are talking about&#8221;? LOVE? What do you know about LOVE? In just two days of our friendship , You took our friendship to love? No.<br />,Rehan: Aizwal, I just want to know about yesterday. You said &#8220;You have no time&#8221;, What does this mean??? Can u tell me??? Aizwal? I am talking to you??<br />,Aizwal: Come with me.<br />,She took Rehan to her home. And gave him her file to read.<br />,Rehan: What is this??<br />,Aizwal: You will get all your answers in this.<br />,And she went in a kitchen.<br />,Rehan: Opened it and started reading..<br />,Tears was falling apart from his face.!!!<br />,He ran towards the kitchen and push Aizwal towards the wall and said, &#8221; You have cancer&#8221;? and started crying on her shoulder.<br />,She bursted in tears&#8230;.<br />,Aizwal controlled her emotions and said. Yes i am at last stage of &#8220;Cancer&#8221;<br />,&#8220;I hope now, you got all your answers. So, Forget me and find someone who can be with you till your entirely life.&#8221;<br />,&#8221;  I have no rights to live in this world,<br />,I have no rights to be happy.,<br />,I have no right to be loved&#8230;<br />,That&#8217;s why , The person whom i loved the most, he left me<br />,Do you hear me&#8221; He Left me alone, in my last days&#8221;<br />,That&#8217;s why , I dont get attached to anyone<br />,That&#8217;s why i was avoiding you,  Ignoring you&#8221;.<br />,Rehan: &#8220;Aizwal, I will not leave you at any cost. See, We met because Destiny want us to be together till our last breath.&#8221;<br />,Aizwal. &#8220;I need to tell you something about me&#8221;.&#8221;<br />,&#8220;I am also a Cancer Patient&#8221;<br />,&#8221; And See our co-incidence, I am also at last stage of cancer&#8221;</p>,<p>By hearing this, Aizwal couldn&#8217;t controlled her emotions and hugged Rehan . And they promised each  other until they are alive, They will be together and happy.<br />,They both took their last breath in each other arms.</p>,<p>No one Knows when their lives going to end, So, Untill you are alive. Live it, Rock it and make your life memorable and happy.<br />,Because, You wont get your life again.</p>,<p>&#8211;END&#8211;</p>,<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div tag-indian-arranged-marriage-stories tag-children tag-family-2 tag-life tag-love tag-love-marriage-stories entry" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting" itemprop="blogPost"><header class="entry-header"><h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">Winds of Love</h1> ,<span class="alignleft"><img alt='' src='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/028d6fead0cea43cc443724cd6dd142f?s=85&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/028d6fead0cea43cc443724cd6dd142f?s=170&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-85 photo' height='85' width='85' /></span><p class="entry-meta">English Short Story published on <time class="entry-time" itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2017-01-06T14:39:32+00:00">January 6, 2017</time> by <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a href="http://yourstoryclub.com/author/jaysree/" class="entry-author-link" itemprop="url" rel="author"><span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">Jaysree</span></a></span> <div class="textwidget"><p><strong>Excerpt: </strong>You are the most beautiful thing that had ever happened to me. To me, your face will be the first thing that comes to my mind, when I see something beautiful. To me, you are the first person, who comes to my mind, when I want to share something  <strong>(Reads: 2,157)</strong> </p></div><section id="text-before-content-ad" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle"></div><div class="textwidget" style="margin-bottom:10px;"><!--AD START--><div style="text-align: center;">,<!-- YSC_RESP_1 -->,<ins class="adsbygoogle",     style="display:block",     data-ad-client="ca-pub-9888966704027314",     data-ad-slot="4736285789",     data-ad-format="auto"></ins>,<script>,(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});,</script>          ,            </div><!--AD END--></div></div></section><section id="text-before-content" class="widget widget_text"><div class="widget-wrap"><div class="widget-title widgettitle">&nbsp;</div><div class="textwidget"></div></div><section></p></header><div class="entry-content" itemprop="text"><div id="attachment_22846" style="width: 460px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"><a href="http://i0.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/love-sign-ribbons.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-22846" src="http://i0.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/love-sign-ribbons.jpg?w=450" alt="love-sign-ribbons" srcset="http://i0.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/love-sign-ribbons.jpg?w=620 620w, http://i0.wp.com/yourstoryclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/love-sign-ribbons.jpg?resize=300%2C155 300w" sizes="(max-width: 620px) 100vw, 620px" data-recalc-dims="1" /></a><p class="wp-caption-text">Love and Family Story of Three Women &#8211; Winds of Love<br />Photo credit: <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/creative/Ladyheart" rel="nofollow external">Ladyheart</a> from <a href="http://www.morguefile.com/" rel="nofollow external">morguefile.com</a></p></div>,<p><em>At some point of time in life, blocked by bricks of fear, insecurity, inefficiency or lack of purpose, we stand still, dejected and despaired, looking at the high wall, which is blocking our way. </em></p>,<p><em>We refuse to meet people, we refuse to smile, we refuse to cheer, and we refuse to socialize, concealing ourselves into a dangerous sphere of worry and anticipation, demotivating ourselves, </em></p>,<p><em>Until……………………………………….</em></p>,<p>&nbsp;</p>,<p><strong>Chapter 1:</strong></p>,<p><strong><em><u>August 21, 2016, 9.00 P.M</u></em></strong></p>,<p><strong><em><u>Velachery, Chennai. </u></em></strong></p>,<p>“Harini, please,” She heard Sai’s voice, which she ignored.</p>,<p>“<em>Bhaiya, tukada Puri deejhiye, </em>” Harini demanded an extra piece , as she relished the last piece of <em>Pani puri</em>.</p>,<p><em>“Bees rupaye ke lie chhah tukade.” </em>The <em>golgappa</em> <em>wala</em> insisted.  “Harini, please don’t argue with him. You already had six right, come on let us leave.” Sai almost pulled her by her arm.  “How much <em>hai</em>?” Sai tried to show her lingual prowess, by stressing on the last word, making an English statement sound like Hindi.  Harini burst into laughter. “He told you. It is twenty bucks,” she spoke as she removed a crisp note and gave it to the shopkeeper.</p>,<p>“Harini, do you really understand why we are here?” Sai asked, as they walked back.</p>,<p>“I know. Dileep is coming to meet me day after tomorrow. I shall drop you at school. We will talk, while we are on the way,” he replied, as he walked to their bedroom.</p>,<p>The pressure cooker had ceased to fizzle, a couple of minutes ago. She had to take out the rice, and let it cool before packing.</p>,<p>A heap of clothes had just come out of the washing machine. She had to put them in the balcony for drying.</p>,<p>She had to get ready.</p>,<p>She just had fifteen minutes. She had no time; even to cry.</p>,<p>Twenty minutes later, as she locked the car’s door, she turned towards Manoj.</p>,<p>“You wanted to talk something?”  Manoj spoke, looking at the road.</p>,<p>“Manoj, I am not going to attend the early morning ritual. Let your mom be there. We three shall join for breakfast.” Aadvika spoke in a low tone.</p>,<p>“If you are not comfortable with it, I am fine. But why?” he asked.</p>,<p>“It will remind me of something, that I am incapable of.” She blurted out.</p>,<p>“Mom is giving an idea to overcome the incapability, right? She just believes being around the votive ritual will bring us some goodness. It is definitely not for bad. No harm giving it a try.”</p>,<p>“This is not the first time, Manoj. I have attended seven such baby shower functions so far.”</p>,<p>“It is still not fruitful. No harm trying the eighth time.”</p>,<p>“Why don’t you think the same in my perspective? No harm missing the Eighth.”</p>,<p>“Don’t put words just to argue.”</p>,<p>“Why would I argue if you understand or acknowledge something, the first time it is said? You are too much biased these days.” Tears swelled up.</p>,<p>“Listen, Aadvika. I am more on the neutral side these days. “</p>,<p>“Ok, in that case, Do you think, what your mom spoke was right?” Aadvika’s voice broke.</p>,<p>“What?” he asked.</p>,<p>“Manoj, do not pretend. Don’t you understand what am I talking about? It is about the curse your mom showered on me this morning.”</p>,<p>“What do you want me to do Aadvika? I cannot stop her. It is her way of expressing her grief.” He shrugged his shoulders.</p>,<p>“You curse others when you are sad?” Aadvika uttered as she looked at the road.</p>,<p>“You blame others when you are impo…,” Manoj stopped as Aadvika’s eyes met his’.</p>,<p>He knew he was wrong. He should not have spoken those words.</p>,<p>“Yes, I am impotent. “, tears ran down her cheeks. “Stop the car, Manoj,”she spoke in between her tears.</p>,<p>He slammed the brake to park the car in a shade. Aadvika was still looking at her husband, who rested his elbow on the steering and held his forehead tight, with both his thumbs.</p>,<p>“Aadvika,  I…, “ he tried to speak.</p>,<p>“I did not expect this from you Manoj.” She covered her face, weeping.</p>,<p>The rest of the travel was silent, except for the sobbing sound.</p>,<p>Her school arrived. Aadvika got down and walked straight.</p>,<p>Aadvika turned towards the car. She expected him to throw a second look at her. He drove fast, skipping the glance.</p>,<p><b>Select Page below to Continue Reading&#8230;</b></p>,<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div class="robots-nocontent sd-block sd-social
